args.natural_language_statement: Let $f \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ be a bounded function, { a_n }_{n=1}^\infty and {b_n }_{n=1}^\infty be sequences such that a < a_n < b_n < b for all n, with \lim_{n\to\infty} a_n = a and \lim_{n\to\infty} b_n = b. Suppose f is Riemann integrable on [a_n,b_n] for all n. Then f is Riemann integrable on [a,b] and \int_a^b f = \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{a_n}^{b_n} f .
